thread.title: Ukip gaining momentum in Stoke by-election says Nigel Farage
thread.title_full: Ukip gaining momentum in Stoke by-election says Nigel Farage

title: Ukip gaining momentum in Stoke by-election says Nigel Farage
text:
GETTY A Leave.EU poll suggested Paul Nutttall was six points ahead of Labour 
And a recent poll by Leave. EU suggested that Mr Nuttall is six points ahead of Labour after Jeremy Corbyn 's candidate Gareth Snell branded Brexit “a pile of sh**" on Twitter. 
The Tories have also put up a Remain supporter Jack Brereton and appear to be lagging a distant third to Mr Nuttall and Labour. 
After a day of campaigning, Mr Farage said: “My sense is that there is real momentum here behind the Ukip campaign in Stoke Central." GETTY Jeremy Corbyn's candidate Gareth Snell tweeted that Brexit was 'a pile of sh**' Nigel Farage in pictures Thu, December 15, 2016 Nigel Farage is a British politician who has been the leader of the UK Independence Party since October 2016. Getty Images 1 of 48 British politician Nigel Farage arrives at Trump Tower on December 15, 2016 in New York City. President-elect Donald Trump and his transition team are in the process of filling cabinet and other high level positions for the new administration. 
Mr Nuttall wants Ukip to become the “party of the patriotic working class" and believes a victory in Stoke could open the floodgates in the north and Midlands as voters abandon Jeremy Corbyn's hard left Labour Party. 
The by-election was called after former Labour MP Tristram Hunt resigned his seat to become director of the V&A Museum. Related articles
